Thanks for the PR! However, I think this is not quite what I was thinking about here: we need to keep this part of the code as simple as possible, and playing loop tricks, while it does get rid of the duplication in spirit, ends up making the logic harder to follow.

Would you consider breaking out the common parts into a function instead?
I had considered use the common function, but I think the method will call this new function many a time in for loop. Now I consider to write a function that it includes for loop, I try it.
